definition: strategic pass/barrier or mark (i.e. a level considered impressive, usually a round figure such as 10,000)/instrument of torture used to break limbs
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
Daguan county in Zhaotong 昭通[Zhao1 tong1], Yunnan

sentences.english: On both Wednesday and Thursday, the price of oil briefly hit $100 a barrel.
sentences.chinese: 國際原油期貨價格一度突破每桶100美元大關。

sentences.english: This game is a total of 8 mark, including 44 mini-puzzle game.
sentences.chinese: 本遊戲一共有8大關，其中包括44個迷你益智遊戲。

sentences.english: Yanmen Pass is an important pass for Shanxi businessmen going west.
sentences.chinese: 雁門關是山西商人西行的大關。

sentences.english: The Shanghai Composite Index jumped after opening, but despite suffering some fluctuations reached near 3100 points during trading.
sentences.chinese: 滬指開盤後震盪上攻，盤中一度逼近3100點大關。

sentences.english: The local shares index has dropped sharply towards the 3000 mark.
sentences.chinese: 本地股指驟降，直逼3000點大關。

sentences.english: The exploration capacity would hit 1 trillion cubic meters.
sentences.chinese: 勘探能力將突破1萬億立方米的大關。

sentences.english: Imports for the first time exceeded $100b since last October.
sentences.chinese: 進口則是去年10月以來首次突破千億美元大關。

sentences.english: Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing saw its profits grow 53 per cent and break through the $1 billion mark for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 港交所純利上升53%，首度突破十億大關。

sentences.english: The Dow breaking 10000 is, we're told, a psychological barrier.
sentences.chinese: 我們被告知，道指突破萬點大關是個心理點位。

definition: Hang Seng index (of Hong Kong stock market)
to touch (physically, one's feelings etc)/to touch on (a topic)
